# Final project

## Final project

- Choose a topic of interest (make sure it is of general interest as well)
- Yes, you can work in teams (up to 3 people) but the expectation will be higher accordingly.


*Deliverables:*

- some form of research in reproducible form in a github repository: code, R package, R markdown, shiny app, ... the `README.md` file documents how files are supposed to be used
- written report (10 pages maximum)
- presentation

## Due dates

- Identify the topic you want to work on. 
- April 4: submit an title and abstract for your project. Identify the github repo in which you are working.
- April 18: submit a draft of your report to get feedback (informal, does not carry a grade)
- April 25, 27, and May 4: Final presentations
- May 5: Final report due
